reviews.review:
Dead By Daylight is a game I've had since it's release but never got around to playing until recently.
After 100+ hours (Not very many considering others) it seems like a fun game to play with your friends, or have in the backround to play while talking to them.
After putting around 50-60 hours into Killer and Survivor, I can say it's easy for killers to make mistakes and completely screw the game over for them. 
As a survivor, I can say that in the ranks I've played in (Up to rank 7) are kind of difficult. While still learning the game it's incredible easy to mess up 3-4 times and loose the game for yourself, and in some cases your whole team.
DBD is a game I love, but it's inconsistent balancing and bugs have driven all my friends who play it away from the game.
If you just want to have fun, not take it seriously, and just have a good time with pals. This is your game. If you want a game that's competitive, maybe find 3 other friends who are willing to dedicate hundreds of hours into the game with you.
Overall, I give DBD a 8/10.

i like this game thats what i like about the game

In itself the game is fun.
However!
You need to grind a lot bevor you can actually play different playstyles. 
For me, that required about 80h bevor I actually had the skills I needed for two builds. 
Because you need to buy survivors and killers and level them up to 40 just so you can get those skills on other survivors too. Most builds require skills from different survivors. Buying new survivors is way too expensive and leveling them takes it's time to.

But the by far worst is their matchmaking system.
The ranked system resets every month which means that you will frequently get matched with people waaaay better then you.
This is especially annoying as a killer. 
As a rank 15 (20 is the worst, 1 the best) killer, I most of the time get matched with survivors around 9-11 and often there will also be a rank1-3 survivor in there. This simply should not be possible. 
Definately not a enjoyable experience.
Great game just wish the queue time was a bit better sometimes.
Really Fun Game!!!  AMAZING! LIT! SICK! FIRE! FUN! AWESOME! BEST!

(survivor main for reference) DbD isn't a horror game in the traditional sense. While you might be scared at first of the killer, the fear quickly wears off as you get better abilities and skill in the game. The horror is more similar to Groundhog day, where you're in an endless loop of repeated actions. It's the same goal and the same handful of maps every time, with the only difference being the monster. However, the monster isn't the killer, but rather the toxic soaked survivors. They will sweat HARD in higher ranks, bringing the most meta perks and items every game. While killers do the same, it's not as annoying since their best perks revolve around finding survivors and injuring them quickly. Survivors perks are all about making the killer want to DC. 
The worst/best is all of the salt thrown at the killer, regardless of how they played. Did they win? Then the killer was a meta-baby tryhard. Lose? The killer is an idiot who should stop sniffing his cum-covered hand long enough to study the meta. No matter what you do as killer, the survivors will torture you. If you're a killer main, the only thing that will keep you going is the few matches where survivors would rather have fun than win. In those lobbies, its a blast. This game is like a desert, shriveling into a ball of boredom, but give you just enough drops of gamer tears to keep you alive and wanting to play. It's a loop that I have yet to escape, but so desperately want to. Be careful, and just remember to have fun, at least until rank 10.

El juego en general es bueno. Tiene buenas mec√°nicas y una idea general que cumple con el punto. La idea de los supervivientes es escapar el mundo generado sin morir en el intento, mientras que del otro lado, el asesino puede sacrificar (o matar en determinados momentos) a los supervivientes para satisfacer al ente, qui√©n es la regidora del entorno y mundo de Dead By Daylight
Siendo un juego asim√©trico, hay muchas quejas de falta de balance, en ciertos aspectos lo tratan de corregir con los parches, pero siempre van a haber quejas. De parte de supervivientes por ventajas del asesino (que en parte esta bien que tenga alguna ventaja, recordemos que es un 1vs4) y por parte de los asesinos por ciertas mec√°nicas que permiten a los supervivientes hacer partidas r√°pidas y no tan divertidas. Escapar es el objetivo, pero la diversi√≥n no se da de escapar de una partida r√°pido, si no de las persecuciones, los momentos claves en los que el asesino esta por atraparte y de alguna u otra forma evadir el ataque y ganar distancia.

El juego es entretenido, para m√≠ que juegue tanto de asesino como superviviente y jugando como superviviente principalmente. El √∫nico problema general que le encuentro como mayor hoy en d√≠a son los servidores. Muchas veces, el juego depende de la conexi√≥n del asesino, m√°s all√° de que todos jueguen en un mismo servidor, se pueden ver golpes "fantasmas" que se dan por variaci√≥n de ping entre el asesino y la victima, pudiendo darse la situaci√≥n de que el superviviente salte por una ventana y a los 2 metros reciba un golpe porque el asesino le dio cuando estaba cruzando la ventana (para √©l). Fuera de eso, hay cosas peque√±as que a algunos los pueden molestar o no, pero son cosas que no pasan en todas las partidas.

Almost any killer you play against is toxic as all hell, if you get matched with random people you may as well write off winning the game, because communication is key in a game like this. Most of the time fellow survivors will just stand there and watch as you die, while they wait to yeet themselves into a hatch. When it comes to killers, most of them just decide to camp your hooked flesh suit, and if they aren't camping you; they're tunnelling another survivor. I absolutely love this game, but the toxicity can become far to much sometimes. I'd give this game a solid 10/10 with a sprinkle of 0.1/10 for toxicity.
Super fun.  A little hard at first, but once I managed to figure out the controls, I have been a lot better.  I am looking forward to owning all the DLC :)

most killers are toxic, your teammates won't help you, and you'll get jump scared every two seconds. But if you play with friends you will laugh, cry, and be full of hatred. truly the monopoly of video games. 10/10

Es un buen juego, un juego muy divertido,pero..... esta poseyendo tristemente una de las comunidades mas toxicas que hay.
Recomiendo el juego, claramente si, en especial si tienes amigos con los que disfrutar y reirse,la diversion y lrisas estaran a la orden del dia,pero si no tienes amigos con los que jugar solo lo recomiendo si eres de los que juegas unas pocas partidas juegos con modalidades multijugador y no te hundes en su "competitivo".
Como todo juego "competitivo", tendras partidas buenas o malas, pero una cosa de este es que la suerte de con quien te enfrentes afecta mucho tu experiencia,jugadores toxicos,trolls,los locos que incluso te mandan mensajes,etc.
Si logras superar o no te afectan esas cosas pues bienvenidos seas

I'd say this game is pretty good. Obviously it's not perfect, and some parts of the gameplay are wonky, but balancing an asymmetrical game with a very... loud community... isn't easy. That being said, the playerbase can be pretty toxic, so I don't recommend it if you're gonna let stuff get to you ://

Queues seem to be better now, but I still think survivor mode should be free so killer queue can be sped up

This game is a very interesting one playing as killer at the start can be quite difficult but once you find your way you can destroy survivors easily. plus the ranking system makes it so your always going against equally good survivors. playing as a survivor can be easy at the start but harder later on as killers get better . there is loads of content to the game you can always improve and even makes some friends while your at it. it isnt everyones cup of tea. but i think its atleast worth a go. also
JUMPSCARES!

The game is extremely terrifying when you first start because you don't know how anything works.  As you learn things, it slowly becomes a competitive game.  Sometimes a little too competitive.  However, no one sends chat messages anymore since cross platform multiplayer was enabled so it is definitely not as toxic as it used to be.  Its a fun game to master and really fun with friends.  Its definitely worth picking up and trying for its price (especially if its on sale).

My only complaint has to be the long queue times as survivor.  Almost everyone plays survivor so sometimes you are waiting up to 10-15 minutes just to load into a game.  This reason right here is kind of why I don't play the game as much anymore.
